University College London

I'm currently working between PKU and UCL, where I explore the exciting field of brain-inspired computing üß†ü§ñ ‚Äî from neural coding and perception to neuromorphic systems and high-speed sensing. I'm particularly interested in building intelligent systems that take inspiration from how the brain sees and acts.

I've led several projects related to neuromorphic cameras and spike-based visual computing üé•‚ö°Ô∏è. I'm very lucky to be mentored by Prof. Tiejun Huang and Prof. Karl Friston, whose guidance continues to shape my thinkingüí°.

I also serve as a reviewer for conferences and journals such as ICML/ICLR/NeurIPS/ICCV/ECCV/CVPR/TIP and Neural Networks. I'm always open to chatting and collaborating on related topics. Feel free to reach out if you're working in this space ‚Äî would love to connect! ü§ù

2023

I was awarded as the Outstanding Postdoctoral Fellowship of Peking University 2023.

Dec 31
Established the official website for SpikeCV at https://spikecv.github.io/.
Nov 02

Our open-source project SpikeCV was honored with the Excellent Incubating Open-source Project Award from OpenI, recognizing its impact and innovation in the field of brain-inspired vision. As the team leader, I was also awarded the Outstanding Developer Award for my contributions to the platform and community.
